entry.title: EU integration bill passes in Armenian parliament

media:group.media:title: EU integration bill passes in Armenian parliament
media:group.media:description:
๐ The Armenian parliament passed a bill in its second and final reading, declaring the countryโs aspiration to join the European Union. ๐ Armeniaโs Defense Ministry acknowledged that gunfire is occasionally heard along the border with Azerbaijan but maintains that it โdoes not target Armenian territory.โ This marks the first official recognition of the tense situation at the frontier after almost two weeks of Azerbaijani reports alleging ceasefire violations by Armenia. ๐ Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan and U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio held a phone conversation to discuss the U.S.-Armenia strategic partnership and regional issues.

entry.title: Armeniaโs Western Pivot: Smart Move or a Risky Gamble?

media:group.media:title: Armeniaโs Western Pivot: Smart Move or a Risky Gamble?
media:group.media:description:
Dr. Pavel Baev, a professor at the Peace Research Institute in Oslo, is in Yerevan to participate in a conference organized by the Caucasus Institute. The program is entitled โGathering Storm: Regional Security of the South Caucasus in the Context of the Crisis of the Global Order.โ Dr. Baev speaks with CivilNet about Russiaโs foreign policy and whether the current geopolitical shifts may see Moscow make a stronger comeback in the South Caucasus. He also assesses Armeniaโs western pivot at this moment when the global liberal order appears to be ending under President Donald Trump.
0:00 Introduction 0:47 How is the changing world order affecting Russia's foreign policy? 5:35 Have Russia's strategic goals in the South Caucasus changed in recent years? 9:13 Did Russia see the 2020 Nagorno-Karabakh War coming or even facilitate it? 10:02 What does Russia make of the ascendent Turkey-Azerbaijan power in the South Caucasus? 13:06 Is Armenia's pivot to Europe wise amid the rise of US-Russia cooperation? 16:13 What is Russia's future in the South Caucasus?

The American University of Armenia is pioneering a masterโs program in multiplatform journalism this June, meant to equip aspiring journalists in the country with the skills to navigate the fast evolving media landscape โ tailored to the Armenian context.
